meeting_annotations.speaker: Carolyn Bayer
meeting_annotations.transcript: You know, we think a lot though about redesigning our systems for improved signal to noise, you know, improved light delivery, you know, and all of those things can work in your favor when you're trying to really push the limits on sensitivity, but we obviously have some big goals and big challenges.

meeting_annotations.transcript: So in addition to what Barbara said, actually, if you try to do photoacoustic imaging on tissues or on animals, you'll see that there is a lot of photoacoustic signal from every layer.
